TF020250-FRENCH CONSULTANTS TRUST FUND,TF031943-TUNISIA;MOROCCO - NATIONAL

abstracts.cdata!:
The assessment of outcome is
            unsatisfactory, sustainability unlikely, although the
            institutional development impact was substantial. On
            reviewing the history of financial intermediation loans in
            the Bank, lessons show that many have been partially, or
            totally cancelled, because demand did not materialize;
            actually, it is flexibility that becomes critical in the
            design of such projects, that is, excessive restrictions on
            clients to which the financial institution could lend,
            should preferably be avoided. In this project, allocation of
            loan funds to specific subproject categories, created an
            unnecessary administrative burden, thus requiring loan
            reallocations during the life of the project. Instead, a
            positive list of subprojects by categories, could have been
            defined, specifying that no single subproject category could
            receive more than, say a certain percentage of the total
            loan proceeds. Moreover, given the project objective to
            support both rural development, and the institutional
            development of a specific bank, a coherent strategy should
            have been in place, and the Bank should have deepened policy
            discussions on ways to support the farmers' financial
            difficulties, by urging the Government to provide direct
            assistance to such farmers.
